channel.title: MY Devotional: Daily Biblical Encouragement & Prayer from Leading The Way
channel.description: Uncompromising Truth for Everyday Faith. MY Devotional is a daily 5-minute (or less) audio devotional and prayer from Leading The Way with Dr. Michael Youssef. Each episode offers Scripture-based encouragement and a short prayer to help you abide in Christ, renew your mind, and walk in God's truthâ€”especially in seasons of anxiety, temptation, and spiritual battle. New episodes every day.

item.title: Freedom from Pessimism
item.description:
Have you been stuck expecting the worstâ€”even in your walk with God?

Over the last few days, weâ€™ve been confronting pessimism through the life of Thomas, the disciple forever nicknamed â€œdoubting Thomas.â€ But Dr. Michael Youssef reveals the deeper issue beneath Thomasâ€™ doubtâ€”and ours: a distorted understanding of who Jesus truly is. With patient love, Christ led Thomas from skepticism to victory, and that same resurrection power can transform you too.

In this episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, youâ€™ll discover:

why doubt often grows from an incomplete view of Christ,

how Jesus personally frees us from pessimism, and

what genuine transformation looks like after we encounter the living Savior.

Thomasâ€™ change wasnâ€™t merely intellectualâ€”it reshaped his entire life. After meeting the risen Christ, he became bold and mission-minded, taking the Gospel into difficult regions such as Nineveh and India. Dr. Youssef reminds us that when we truly grasp Godâ€™s calling and His unconditional love, pessimism gives way to Spirit-empowered hopeâ€”pessimistic to visionary, uncertain to confident, and hopeless to joyful.

If youâ€™re tired of negative â€œwhat ifs,â€ chronic doubt, or spiritual hesitation, this devotional will point you back to the One who has the final word over every fear:

â€œSo if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeedâ€ (John 8:36).

Scripture Focus: John 8:36

The voice you hear on the MY Devotional podcast is digitally generated with Dr. Youssef's permission. If todayâ€™s devotional stirred a question, burden, or need for prayer, you donâ€™t have to walk through it alone.

item.title: God Overpowers Our Pessimism
item.description:
Do you ever feel your faith shrink after a setbackâ€”like hope is slipping through your fingers?

In this episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef continues the journey of overcoming pessimism by revealing the next steps toward steady confidence in Christ. While yesterdayâ€™s foundation was knowing who you are in Jesus, today tackles what happens when fear, opposition, or disappointment hits your â€œhot buttonsâ€ and you start expecting the worst.

Through the life of Thomas, Dr. Youssef highlights how Jesus overpowers pessimism in real time:

How to handle setbacks without losing confidence (John 11): Thomas assumed following Jesus to Bethany would end in deathâ€”but Jesus shattered that fear by raising Lazarus, proving His authority even over the grave.

How Christâ€™s resurrection defeats chronic doubt (John 20:25â€“28): Thomas demanded proofâ€”until the risen Jesus stood before him. Encountering the living Christ transformed him from skeptic to worshiper: â€œMy Lord and my God!â€

Why your hope is never tied to circumstances: Jesus is alive, reigning at the right hand of the Father, and still redeeming situations that look beyond repair.

If youâ€™ve been bracing for disappointment, stuck in â€œrealisticâ€ negativity, or quietly wondering if God will come throughâ€”this devotional will help you remember what Thomas learned firsthand: the resurrected Christ changes whatâ€™s possible.

Scripture Focus: Psalm 66:5

The voice you hear on the MY Devotional podcast is digitally generated with Dr. Youssef's permission. If todayâ€™s devotional stirred a question, burden, or need for prayer, you donâ€™t have to walk through it alone.

item.title: Overcoming Pessimism with Godâ€™s Love
item.description:
Pessimism is one of the quietest threats to a growing faithâ€”because it often sounds like wisdom. We rename it â€œdiscernment,â€ â€œcaution,â€ or â€œbeing realistic,â€ but Scripture exposes what it truly is: a lack of faith in Godâ€™s power or His promises.

In this episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef takes you to Mark 9, where a desperate father says to Jesus, â€œIf you canâ€¦â€â€”revealing the real issue wasnâ€™t Jesusâ€™ ability, but the fatherâ€™s unbelief. Christâ€™s reply still challenges us today: faith changes what we believe is possible.

Dr. Youssef also points to Thomas, famously labeled â€œdoubting Thomas,â€ to show that pessimism doesnâ€™t have to be permanent. Jesus overcame Thomasâ€™ unbelief by anchoring him in a life-altering truth: you are chosen, called, and unconditionally loved by Godâ€™s grace.

If youâ€™ve been battling negativity, doubt, or a constant expectation of the worst, this devotional will help you:

identify pessimism for what it is,

bring your unbelief honestly to Jesus, and

rest in the security of Godâ€™s steadfast love and calling.

Scripture Focus: 1 John 3:1

item.title: The Power of Christ: February 25, 2026
item.description:
What are you drawing on for strengthâ€”your circumstances, your abilities, or the power of Christ?

In todayâ€™s episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef reminds us that only Christâ€™s resurrection power can truly satisfy the empty heart, defeat temptation, and exchange our weakness for His strength. Earthly assets and â€œwinsâ€ may look impressive, but theyâ€™re nothing compared to the transforming power of Jesus.

This devotional also sounds a loving warning: when life is going well, itâ€™s easy to drift back into independence and forget the Source of real joy. Thatâ€™s why we must stay alert to spiritual stagnation and choose growthâ€”even when growth stretches us.

Youâ€™ll be encouraged by Scriptureâ€™s call to keep pressing forward:

Run with perseverance, throwing off sin and fixing your eyes on Jesus (Hebrews 12:1â€“2).

Press on toward the goal, forgetting whatâ€™s behind and straining toward whatâ€™s ahead (Philippians 3:13â€“14).

If youâ€™ve been tempted to coast, quit, or rely on comfort instead of Christ, this episode will re-center your heart on the One whose power never runs outâ€”and whose grace meets you in the struggle.

Scripture Focus: Psalm 147:5

item.title: Staying on the Way of Contentment: February 24, 2026
item.description:
Everyone has weaknessesâ€”but not everyone knows what to do with them.

In this episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef exposes a subtle trap the enemy uses to keep believers restless: refusing to confront our weaknesses. Whether your struggle is physical, emotional, mental, or spiritual, unresolved weakness can breed discontentment and quietly drain your joyâ€”unless you apply Godâ€™s grace to the very places that hurt.

Dr. Youssef takes you to Paulâ€™s â€œthorn in the fleshâ€ and the breakthrough lesson God taught him:

â€œMy grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weaknessâ€ (2 Corinthians 12:9).

Youâ€™ll discover why the most important part of any trial isnâ€™t the struggle itselfâ€”but how you respond to it. If youâ€™ve ever felt like Godâ€™s grace â€œisnâ€™t enough,â€ this episode helps you diagnose whatâ€™s really happening: either youâ€™re fixated on the problem instead of His grace, or youâ€™re avoiding the issue entirely. The way forward is not denial or despairâ€”itâ€™s honest dependence on Christ.

Youâ€™ll also be reminded that Jesus is not distant from your struggle. He understands your weakness with compassionâ€”and He invites you to come to Him for strength and mercy (Hebrews 4:15).

Scripture Focus: 2 Corinthians 12:9

From Habakkuk to the New Testament, Godâ€™s message remains the sameâ€”faith isnâ€™t a one-time decision; itâ€™s the way Godâ€™s people live.

Dr. Youssef walks through how faith anchors every part of the believerâ€™s life:

Past: You trusted Jesus and were saved by graceâ€”rescued from hell to heaven.

Present: You rely on Christ daily for provision, wisdom, victory over sin, and strength to obey.

Future: You live with confidence that when you leave this world, you will be with Jesus forever.

In this powerful episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef unpacks the life-changing Truth of Godâ€™s pursuing graceâ€”from the Garden of Eden to your present struggles. Before grace, we were spiritually dead, enslaved to sin, and powerless to change. But through the Gospel of Jesus Christ, God entered the sceneâ€”not merely to impress us with His omnipotence, but to rescue us from eternal death and bring us into abundant life (John 1:16).

Drawing from the sweeping narrative of Scripture and the transforming power of the Holy Spirit, Dr. Youssef reminds us:

Godâ€™s grace awakens the spiritually dead.

Godâ€™s grace empowers us to overcome sinâ€™s strongholds.

Godâ€™s grace sustains us when we stray.

Godâ€™s grace assures us of eternal hope.

Even when we falter, the Lord remains steadfastâ€”the â€œHound of Heaven,â€ faithfully pursuing His children. Through Christ, we are not merely survivors of sinâ€™s battleâ€”we are conquerors.

If you are struggling with guilt, spiritual apathy, or discouragement, this devotional will anchor your heart in the unchanging grace of God and call you to renewed surrender to the Spiritâ€™s work in your life.

â€œOut of his fullness we have all received grace in place of grace already givenâ€ (John 1:16).

Listen now and rediscover the awe-inspiring grace that saves, sanctifies, and secures you for eternity.

If youâ€™re trying to grow closer to Jesus and keep hitting resistance, youâ€™re not aloneâ€”and youâ€™re not failing. In todayâ€™s MY Devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef shows why obstacles are part of the journey of faith and how your response to them can either stifle spiritual growth or strengthen it.

Youâ€™ll learn the three common blockers that quietly weaken intimacy with Christ:

An inability to accept correction â€” A teachable heart is a clear sign of maturity. How you respond when a godly believer points out blind spots reveals a lot about your love for Jesus.

An unwillingness to change â€” Sanctification means continual growth. The moment we stop changing, we step into spiritual danger.

Confusing the journey for the destination â€” Are you living as a citizen of this world with a passing interest in heaven, or as a citizen of heaven passing through this world? (Philippians 3:20â€“21)

This episode will help you reframe spiritual resistance, recognize whatâ€™s holding you back, and pursue Jesus with renewed focusâ€”right where you are.

item.title: Longing for More of Jesus: February 18th, 2026
item.description:

In this episode of the MY Devotional Podcast, Dr. Michael Youssef points to the apostle Paul as a striking example: a man with an impressive religious rÃ©sumÃ© who came to see every achievement as â€œgarbageâ€ compared to the surpassing worth of knowing Christ (Philippians 3:8â€“9). Why? Because genuine love for Jesus never settles into complacency. It longs for more.

Youâ€™ll hear why spiritual growth often begins with a simple, honest confession:
â€œLord, my love for You feels shallowâ€”change me.â€

Dr. Youssef reminds us that Jesus longs to:

nourish your mind with Truth,

fill your heart with His love,

lift your imagination to eternal priorities, and

shape your will through surrender to His Spirit.

But it starts with a holy dissatisfactionâ€”an ache that refuses mediocrity and chooses to seek God with the whole heart.

In this timely teaching from Revelation 2-3, Dr. Youssef leads you through important warnings and uplifting encouragements from Christ Himself delivered in His seven letters to the seven churches of Revelationâ€”words just as relevant today as they were to the first century church. Jesusâ€™ letters teach His followers how to live victoriously in times of peril and hostile opposition, so may we heed them closely as the world grows darker and more evil.Â 

Request your copy today for your gift of any amount!

item.title: Giving From the Heart: December 28, 2024

item.title: Giving That Pleases God: December 27, 2024
item.description:
When we think of generosity, we often think of giving money freely, randomly, exuberantly, and at no real cost to our livelihood. Many are paralyzed by this definition, using it as an excuse to hold tightly to their finances until they can "afford" to give. Yet, living generously is not solely about money. First and foremost, it is about the heart. In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef explains the concept of â€œheart giving.â€Â

item.title: The Shalom of the Prince of Peace: December 23, 2024
item.description:
Before Jesus came, we lived under a burden of sin from which we could not escape, with a gulf between us and God that we could not bridge. The broken world had long been pining for peace. Sin is a heavy burden, and separation from God is the deepest ache of the soul. But God knew exactly what we needed and wanted us to know who was coming.Â In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef considers true peace as the only source of that peace.Â

Counselors provide guidance, support, and encouragement. Yet no matter how helpful, well-trained, or well-intentioned human counselors are, none can compare to our Wonderful Counselor, Jesus Christ.

When we are lonely, we call a friend or a family member. However, as Christians, we sometimes fail to recognize our greatest needs and the best way to satisfy them.Â In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef teaches that God is the only One who can fill us with unspeakable joy.

item.itunes:title: God is the Source: December 9, 2024
item.itunes:author: Dr. Michael Youssef
item.itunes:summary:
In our daily lives, we are quick to satisfy our desires. When we are hungry, we try to eat as quickly as possible. When we are thirsty, we head for the water fountain.
When we are lonely, we call a friend or a family member. However, as Christians, we sometimes fail to recognize our greatest needs and the best way to satisfy them.Â In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef teaches that God is the only One who can fill us with unspeakable joy.

item.title: Facing a Crossroads: November 28, 2024
item.description:
In 1 Kings 18, we see that Israel was at a crossroads. They had lost their awe of God. To them, He was a million miles away. They still claimed to follow Jehovah, but He was no longer a part of their daily lives. God knew that only a vivid reminder of His power would awaken these people from their spiritual sleep. So God used Elijah to bring about a turning point in their lives. In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef looks at Elijahâ€™s powerful confrontation with the pagan prophets.Â  Â

item.title: Maintaining Our Identity: October 1, 2024
item.description:
When Daniel and his friends were taken captive to Babylon, they found themselves in a world completely unlike their own. Even their names were changed to align with the pagan culture around them. Facing pressure to conform and worship false gods, it would have been easy for them to give in and lose their true identity. In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef explores how Daniel resisted an oppressive society, encouraging Christ followers today to stand firm in their identity in Christ.

If you would like more insight into todayâ€™s devotional topic, watch or listen toÂ Dr. Michael Youssefâ€™s sermon series Discover the Power of One:Â LISTEN NOW |Â WATCH NOW

AVAILABLE NOW FOR YOUR GIFT OF ANY AMOUNT

Do you know where to turn in the midst of brokenness? Have you exchanged self-reliance for absolute trust in the living God?Â 

InÂ A Heart for God: Lessons from the Life of David, Dr. Michael Youssef takes you on a journey through the highs and lows of Davidâ€™s life. As you explore his greatest victories and deepest failures in First and Second Samuel, youâ€™ll see Godâ€™s faithfulness to use willing vessels for His glory. As you experience Davidâ€™s most desperate cries in the Psalms, youâ€™ll witness the power of a life completely surrendered to God. And as you see the grander picture of Davidâ€™s life, youâ€™ll also discover how it all points to Christ Jesus, the perfect King who uses broken people to do great things for His Kingdom.Â Request your copy today for your gift of any amount!

We despise disunity and spend enormous amounts of time trying to repair such problems. But when attempts to bring about resolution fail, we often run, abandoning the problem and situation altogether. In todayâ€™s devotional, Dr. Michael Youssef reminds us that God uses all things, including trials, for our blessing.Â
